body:
Hello @mroeschke! Thanks for updating the PR.

 - In the file [`pandas/core/tools/datetimes.py`](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/e9320f103291d83c7db7917cb513e02749447ae4/pandas/core/tools/datetimes.py), following are the PEP8 issues :

> [Line 243:17](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/e9320f103291d83c7db7917cb513e02749447ae4/pandas/core/tools/datetimes.py#L243): [E722](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20E722) do not use bare except'
> [Line 315:9](https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/e9320f103291d83c7db7917cb513e02749447ae4/pandas/core/tools/datetimes.py#L315): [E722](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20E722) do not use bare except'

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/21702?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [7cd2679...e9320f1](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/21702?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
lgtm. can you do a perf check to make sure nothing changed (as the caching logic was lightly touched here)

My asv setup is still a little broken, but here's a benchmark showing no performance hit (with cache)

```
In [1]: from pandas import *

In [3]: N = 100

In [4]: dup_string_with_tz = ['2000-02-11 15:00:00-0800'] * N

# this branch
In [5]: %timeit to_datetime(dup_string_with_tz, cache=True)
1.31 ms ± 44.5 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)

In [6]: %timeit to_datetime(dup_string_with_tz, cache=False)
2.3 ms ± 41.2 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100 loops each)

# Master
In [4]: %timeit to_datetime(dup_string_with_tz, cache=True)
1.29 ms ± 13.3 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)

In [5]: %timeit to_datetime(dup_string_with_tz, cache=False)
2.31 ms ± 68.9 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100 loops each)
```
thanks @mroeschke happily take refactorings to clean up things / make more readable
